question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Shared Object Creation] Lines 59-70 create and share an aggregator - can unlimited shared object creation be used to DoS the network by bloating global state or causing consensus performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: run()] [Name Squatting] name parameter at line 84 is unrestricted - can an attacker register aggregators with names like 'ETH/USD' or 'Official BTC Price' to confuse users and redirect oracle queries to malicious feeds? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: run()] [Resource Exhaustion via String] name is String type at line 84 with no length limit - can an attacker pass gigabyte-sized strings to exhaust transaction gas or storage, causing DoS during aggregator creation or event emission? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Event Emission Cost] AggregatorCreated event at lines 73-77 is emitted for every creation - can an attacker exploit free aggregator creation to spam events, degrading indexer/RPC performance for monitoring legitimate price feeds? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Event Before Sharing] AggregatorCreated event is emitted at line 77 but aggregator sharing happens in aggregator::new() at line 59 - if sharing fails, is the event still emitted, creating false success signals that confuse monitoring systems? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Aggregator ID Extraction Timing] aggregator_id is obtained from aggregator::new() at line 59 but we don't see the return signature - if this function can fail after ID assignment, can partial state lead to ID leakage or orphaned aggregators? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Name Not Validated for Duplicates] name at line 75 is emitted in event without uniqueness check - can multiple aggregators with identical names cause indexer confusion, making it impossible to distinguish between legitimate and malicious oracles? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: run()] [Transaction Failure After Validation] validate() succeeds at lines 93-100 but actuate() could fail at lines 101-112 - can this create a state where parameters are checked but aggregator creation fails silently, wasting gas and creating ambiguity? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Unchecked aggregator::new Return] aggregator::new() is called at line 59 with no error handling visible - if this function has internal validation or can panic, can an attacker craft inputs that pass validate() but cause aggregator::new() to abort, creating DoS? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Queue ID Extraction] queue.id() is called at line 60 - if Queue object state is corrupted or id() returns incorrect/stale ID, can aggregators be created referencing non-existent or malicious queues? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/aggregator/aggregator_init_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Context Manipulation] ctx is passed at line 69 - if aggregator::new() uses ctx.sender() for any authorization, can the entry function caller impersonate the intended authority since authority is a separate parameter? Can a vector with capacity 32 but length 0 pass validation causing downstream crashes? (Low)
